Completing a trade with the San Diego Chargers made two days earlier, the Tampa Bay Buccaneers signed the running back Gary Anderson to a four-year, $3.6 million contract yesterday.

Anderson, who rushed for more than 1,000 yards in 1988 but sat out last season in a contract dispute, was acquired Thursday in a deal contingent on Anderson's agreeing to terms with Tampa Bay by noon in Tampa yesterday. The Chargers will receive a third-round draft pick this year and a second- or third-round pick next year.
''I'm just glad this is behind me,'' said Anderson, who is 29 years old and has made his home in Tampa since his playing days with the Bandits of the now-defunct United States Football League.

Last year, Anderson rejected a contract offer from San Diego worth $512,000 a season. He received a $400,000 signing bonus from Tampa Bay and will receive a salary of $600,000 this year.(AP) SPORTS PEOPLE
